page.title: 02Schools in the area.
page.content: There are two Primary (age of children 5-11) Schools in Tean. Greatwood is a County Primary School,St Thomas' a Roman Catholic one. Greatwood was started in 1885, St Thomas' in 1889 but both now occupy modern buildings. Class sizes range from 25-35 in Greatwood and 23-29 in St Thomas'. Greatwood has 232 children and 10 staff. St Thomas' 107 and 5 staff. Greatwood's children come from Tean (1 'bus child) whereas those at St Thomas'are from a wider area with 30 travelling into school by 'bus or car. At each School about 60 children have school lunches, most of the remainder bringing sandwiches.At Secondary transfer age (11) the children of the area go to Cheadle where there are 2 Comprehensive High Schools, one County and one Roman Catholic. The Primary School at Freehay closed in 1981 due to lack of numbers.
